nodes.bodyText:
We already have a command ./gradlew build in line 96 above. build includes test and quality tasks when it executes. Instead of demonstrating all other possible commands here (the list could be very long), I would suggest to clarify line 92 in this way:

You should be able to run the following command to build ServiceTalk and verify that all tests and code quality checks pass:

Also, in CONTRIBUTING.adoc's checklist we suggest contributors to run ./gradlew build before opening a PR. This should be enough.
@NiteshKant wdyt?

nodes.bodyText:
There is almost no difference between running test quality instead of build task, performance and execution time will be the same. We run them separately on CI to avoid running quality task twice: for JDK8 and JDK11. This is the only reason.
If build misses something compare to test quality this is an issue that needs to be addressed.
